sentences.en: As usual when things weren't going her way, Mary turned quite sulky.
sentences.cn: 像往常一样,事情一不顺心, 玛丽就会郁郁不乐.

sentences.en: By now my halfawake and sulky men were clattering into shape on the road.
sentences.cn: 到现在,我那些半睡半醒的,恼怒的兵士呼啦啦地在路上排起队来.

sentences.en: He put on a sulky expression.
He was very sulky about it indeed.
He went to town by a sulky.
sentences.cn: 他乘单座二轮马车进城了.

sentences.en: I see that Basil is in one of his sulky moods.
sentences.cn: 我觉得贝西尔现在情绪很低沉.

sentences.en: I should have been sulky and mean.
sentences.cn: 其实,我应该阴沉而自卑.

sentences.en: Katherine sat in a sulky silence.
sentences.cn: 凯瑟琳闷闷不乐地坐着，一声不吭。

sentences.en: My half - awake and sulky men were clattering into shape on the road.
sentences.cn: 我那些半睡 半 醒的恼怒的士兵哗啦啦地在大路上排起队来.

sentences.en: Philip passed off her sulky reply with a laugh.
sentences.cn: 菲利浦对她气呼呼的回答一笑置之.

sentences.en: Sarah had looked sulky all morning.
sentences.cn: 萨拉一上午都不高兴地板着脸。

sentences.en: She brought along a couple of sulky looking kids.
sentences.cn: 她带来几个脸色愠怒的孩子.

sentences.en: She is stubborn, sulky and contrary where her music is concerned.
sentences.cn: 与她的音乐有关的方面,她固执, 易怒而执拗.

sentences.en: Spoiled children become sulky if they cannot have their own way.
sentences.cn: 纵坏了的孩子如果不能为所欲为,便要不高兴.

sentences.en: Warrington laughed loudly so that Pen grew sulky.
sentences.cn: 沃林顿对着他大笑,弄得潘十分尴尬.

sentences.en: With his papa he was silent and sulky, seldom making his appearance.
sentences.cn: 见了他的爸爸,他一声不吭,绷着脸皮, 而且尽量少露面.

sentences.en: Young girls sometimes become sulky because they are jealous.
sentences.cn: 少女们因为嫉妒而有时变得很不高兴.

words.tran_cn: 愠怒的，不高兴的；（天气）阴沉的；沉闷的

trans.tran_cn: 愠怒的，绷着脸的，生闷气的，不搭理人的
